item.title: Binary exponentiation
item.description: Exponents rules $$ a^{m} \cdot a^{n} = a^{m+n} $$ $$ \frac{a^{m}}{a^{n}} = a^{m-n} $$ $$ (a^{m})^{n} = a^{m \cdot n} $$ Binary exponentiation Exponentiation means to multiply a b-times. $$ a \cdot a \cdot a = a^{b} $$ Multiplying each term b-times will give O(b) complexity. Demonstrate binary exponentiation on $$ 2^{10} $$ Lets write 10 in binary 1010. The corresponding bits will be used
